introduction_japanese: 昼間。仕事や学校のある時間や、太陽が出ているときの予定の話でよく使います。
introduction_english: Hiruma (ひるま). We use it for times when people are at work or school, and for plans while the sun is out.
meaning_explanation_japanese: 夜ではなく、太陽が出ている時間を指します。
meaning_explanation_english: It is used as a noun and an adverbial time word. Hiruma (ひるま) points to the hours when the sun is out, not at night.
youtube_description: Learn “昼間 (ひるま)” in minutes—meaning, nuance, and natural phrases for beginner Japanese. Easy examples and useful collocations for daily conversation.

common_words: 昼食（ちゅうしょく）: lunch
昼休み（ひるやすみ）: lunch break
間に合う（まにあう）: to be in time

kanji_explanation: The first kanji means day and noon. It’s about the bright part of the day. You see it in ちゅうしょく and ひるやすみ. Think lunch and breaks when the sun is high. The second kanji means interval or gap. It talks about the space or time between things. You see it in じかん and まにあう. It helps measure or catch a time window.
synonyms: 日中 : にっちゅう : daytime
synonym_explanation: The most common synonyms of the word are にっちゅう. にっちゅう is a bit formal or written; ひるま is more common in everyday speech.
antonym_explanation: The most common antonyms of the word are よる. ひるま is when the sun is out, while よる is after sunset and dark.
